content.description: The Federal Reserve kept interest rates unchanged in June, but signaled the potential for two rate cuts later this year.
U.S. equity futures declined amid fears of direct U.S. involvement in the Israel-Iran conflict, raising concerns about oil-driven inflation.
New York City’s congestion pricing has reduced Manhattan traffic delays by 25% and cut gridlock in nearby New Jersey by up to 14%, easing concerns about negative spillover effects.

U.S.–China trade talks in London resulted in a draft agreement that stabilizes relations, with key issues remaining around rare earths and semiconductor access; final approval pending from Presidents Trump and Xi.

OpenAI plans to convert its for-profit division into a public benefit corporation under nonprofit oversight, but faces internal conflict with Microsoft, risking up to $20 billion in funding if unresolved by year-end.

outlook: The medium-term S&P 500 outlook looks positive if Fed cuts materialize and geopolitical risks don’t escalate. However, any disruption—especially oil-driven inflation or AI sector hiccups—could lead to sharp pullbacks.
